intro: Hyoscyamus camerarii var. villosus, commonly known as the woolly thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that contain toxic seeds, making it potentially harmful to animals and humans. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides.
